factoid: Telyánin’s face was pale and terrified.
Telyánin’s facial muscles began to quiver.
Telyánin’s eyes shifted from side to side with a downward look that did not rise to Rostóv’s face.
Telyánin’s sobs were audible.
The Count addressed Telyánin and told him not to ruin a young fellow.
The Count gave Telyánin wretched money.
The Count told Telyánin to take the money.
The Count threw the wretched money on the table.
The Count said he had an old father.
The Count said he had an old mother.
Rostóv took the money.
Rostóv avoided Telyánin’s eyes.
Rostóv went out of the room without a word.
Rostóv stopped at the door and retraced his steps.
Rostóv said "O God" with tears in his eyes, asking how could you do it.
Telyánin said "Count" while drawing nearer to Rostóv.
Rostóv said "Don’t touch me" and drew back.
Rostóv said "If you need it, take the money."
Rostóv threw the purse to Telyánin.
Rostóv ran out of the inn.
That evening, there was an animated discussion among the squadron’s officers in Denísov’s quarters.
Staff captain Kírsten told Rostóv that he must apologize to Colonel Bogdánich.
Staff captain Kírsten was tall, grizzly-haired, had enormous mustaches, and many wrinkles on his large features.
Rostóv was crimson with excitement.
Staff captain Kírsten had twice been reduced to the ranks for affairs of honor.
Staff captain Kírsten had twice regained his commission.
Rostóv cried "I will allow no one to call me a liar!"
Rostóv said the colonel told him he lied.
Rostóv said he told the colonel he lied.
Rostóv said no one can make him apologize.
Rostóv said Colonel Bogdánich is commander of the regiment.
Staff captain Kírsten interrupted and stroked his long mustache.
Staff captain Kírsten said "You just wait a moment, my dear fellow, and listen."
Staff captain Kírsten said "You tell the colonel in the presence of other officers that an officer has stolen."
Rostóv said he is not to blame that the conversation began in the presence of other officers.
Rostóv said perhaps he ought not to have spoken before them.
Rostóv said he is not a diplomatist.
Rostóv said that’s why he joined the hussars.
Rostóv said he thought here one would not need finesse.
Rostóv said the colonel tells him he is lying.
Rostóv said let the colonel give him satisfaction.
Staff captain Kírsten said "That’s all right. No one thinks you a coward, but that’s not the point."
Staff captain Kírsten asked Denísov whether it is not out of the question for a cadet to demand satisfaction of his regimental commander.
Denísov sat gloomily biting his mustache and listening to the conversation.
Denísov had no wish to take part in the conversation.
Denísov answered Staff captain Kírsten’s question with a disapproving shake of his head.
Staff captain Kírsten said "You speak to the colonel about this nasty business before other officers."
Staff captain Kírsten said "Bogdánich shuts you up."
Rostóv said the colonel did not shut him up, but said he was telling an untruth.
Staff captain Kírsten said "Well, have it so, and you talked a lot of nonsense to him and must apologize."
Rostóv exclaimed "Not on any account!"
